After three years of pandemic restrictions, travelers are flocking to Europe in record numbers, despite high airfares, limited accommodations and crowded sites. Venues such as the Louvre in Paris and the Vatican in Rome are already teeming with tourists, and Sicily has become a popular destination due to the release of the second season of HBO's hit show "The White Lotus." Demand has been so high that many travel advisers have had to turn away clients looking to book vacations in popular European destinations in July and August due to a lack of availability. American travelers are among those taking advantage of the opportunity to visit Europe, with London, Paris, Rome, Lisbon and Athens among the most booked cities on the Hopper travel app. Elizabeth Hughes, an occupational therapist from Chicago, sold her car to fund a four-week itinerary in eight countries, while Aiden Judson and his wife Laura had to contend with crowded streets and loud tourists on their honeymoon in Sicily. The European Travel Commission's survey revealed that most Europeans are planning to travel before August, the busiest vacation month, to get ahead of rising travel costs and extreme weather conditions. Travelers are advised to consider postponing their trips to the fall, when there is more availability and fewer crowds.

  2. The second season of HBO's hit show "The White Lotus" has made Sicily a popular destination.
  3. London, Paris, Rome, Lisbon, and Athens are among the most booked cities on the Hopper travel app.
  4. Demand for European travel has been so high that many travel advisers have had to turn away clients.
  5. Many Europeans are planning to travel before August to get ahead of rising travel costs and extreme weather conditions.
